targetAudience: Industrial R&D teams (materials, climate, fusion, power)

research.researchNotes: Initial research completed via ChatGPT template

crm.ideaNotes: DOE Genesis Mission represents a major alignment point for AI-native engineering teams. Need to create a comprehensive readiness pack that helps teams prepare for potential participation, collaboration, and integration requests. Focus on developer-ready artifacts and AI-copilot friendly workflows.
crm.icpSummary: Energy-sector software vendors, grid operations technology providers, applied AI companies, scientific computing partners, federal contractors, and industrial R&D teams working in materials, climate, fusion, and power sectors.
primaryPainPoints: Lack of structured readiness frameworks for Genesis Mission participation
Unclear technical requirements and integration points
Missing developer-ready compliance templates and automation
No AI-copilot friendly workflows for Genesis alignment
Gap between policy requirements and engineering implementation
crm.valueHypothesis: Provides a complete toolkit that turns Genesis Mission requirements into actionable engineering artifacts, reducing preparation time from months to weeks and enabling AI-assisted compliance workflows.
crm.pricingNotes: $199 one-time purchase per organization. Positioned as a professional pack with free tier available on GitHub. Price point balances accessibility with value perception.
crm.competitionNotes: No direct competitors offering AI-native compliance packs for Genesis Mission. General compliance tools exist but lack the developer-focused, AI-copilot friendly approach. Opportunity to establish category leadership.

gateDecisionNotes.validation: Validated strong market need through initial research. Target audience clearly defined and accessible. Technical requirements well-documented by DOE.
gateDecisionNotes.scoring: Score: 85/100. Strong value proposition, clear ICP, validated pain points. Gate: PASS. Ready for deep-dive research phase.
gateDecisionNotes.deep_dive: Comprehensive research completed via ChatGPT template. All 16 sections generated with detailed technical overview, checklists, and AI copilot playbooks. Research artifacts ready for pack creation.

targetAudience: Individual tax preparers (CPAs, enrolled agents, tax professionals)
Software vendors building tax preparation tools
Tax professionals handling pass-through entities (K-1s, partnerships, S-corps)

research.researchNotes: Research completed for 2025 tax year readiness

crm.ideaNotes: 2025 tax year brings significant changes: new Form 1099-DA for digital assets, expanded e-filing requirements, inflation adjustments, and Direct File expansion. Individual tax preparers need systematic preparation tools. Opportunity to create AI-native tax readiness pack similar to Genesis structure.
crm.icpSummary: Individual tax preparers (CPAs, enrolled agents, tax professionals), tax preparation firms, software vendors building tax tools, accounting firms serving individual clients, and professionals handling pass-through entities.
primaryPainPoints: Complex 2025 tax year changes require extensive research and preparation
New Form 1099-DA digital asset reporting requirements
Lack of structured workflows for tax year readiness
Need for AI-assisted tax preparation workflows
Client communication challenges around new requirements
crm.valueHypothesis: Provides comprehensive 2025 tax year readiness toolkit with checklists, form processing guides, AI copilot playbooks, and client communication templates. Reduces preparation time and ensures compliance with new requirements.
crm.pricingNotes: $199 one-time purchase per organization. Same pricing as Genesis pack for consistency. Targets professional tax preparers and firms who value structured workflows and AI-native tooling.
crm.competitionNotes: Traditional tax software (TurboTax, H&R Block) focuses on end-user filing, not preparer readiness. Tax research services exist but lack the developer-focused, AI-copilot approach. Opportunity in the preparer tooling market.

gateDecisionNotes.validation: Validated strong need through tax professional research. 2025 changes are well-documented by IRS. Target audience is clearly defined and accessible through professional networks.
gateDecisionNotes.scoring: Score: 90/100. Excellent market fit, clear ICP, validated pain points, strong timing with 2025 tax year. Gate: PASS. Ready for deep-dive research phase.
gateDecisionNotes.deep_dive: Comprehensive research completed covering all 2025 tax year changes, form requirements, e-filing mandates, and digital asset reporting. Research artifacts include detailed checklists and AI copilot playbooks for tax workflows.
